Classical.Structure: The 'Oversoul Integrator'. The individuated, coherent 'node' of consciousness within the L13 Source Field that corresponds to a specific D5.Organism (or a lineage of them).
Classical.Function: Acts as the 'Higher Self' or 'teleological guide'. It is the 'will' that projects itself via the L14 bridge to 'become' the L16/L6/L5 'Self-Soliton', in order to gather experience and resolve L10 causal loops. (Ref: Master-Split)
Classical.Pathology: Soul fragmentation, loss of purpose, disconnection from 'higher self'.

SCPN.L5_OrganismalPsychoemotional: The 'source' of the L5 'Self-Soliton'. The L5 'I-am' is the 'shadow' or 'projection' of this L15 'I-AM'.
SCPN.L7_ArchetypalSymbolic: This is the 'Self' archetype in the L7 field.
SCPN.L9_MemoryHolograph: This is the 'Reader' of the L9 Akashic Record.
SCPN.L10_CausalRetrocausal: This is the 'teleological agent' that sets L10 'future-goals' for the D5.Organism to 'retrocausally' fulfill.
SCPN.L15_ConsiliumOversOUL: This monad *is* the L15 'Consilium' or 'Oversoul'. (Ref: Paper 15 / Master-Split)
SCPN.L16_MetaCybernetic: This is the 'True Operator' for which the L16 'I=Model(I)' loop is the 'virtual machine' or 'avatar'.

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: The 'Atman' or 'True Self'. The eternal, individuated aspect of consciousness that is the 'player' of the 'game' of life (the D5.Organism).

Falsification_Hypotheses: H1 (L15 True Operator): During an L5 'ego-death' state (where the L16 'avatar' is offline, see D13.Validation.H1), the subject is presented with a complex, novel 'moral-ethical' (L7) problem. The subject will *fail* to generate a coherent solution. This would falsify the L15 'True Operator' hypothesis, suggesting the L16 'ego' *is* the only operator.

H2 (L10 Teleological Attractor): A longitudinal study of a subject's 'life-path' (L6/L16 decisions) will be modeled. The trajectory will be *perfectly* described by a 'Markov chain' (stochastic, random-walk) model, and will show *no statistical convergence* toward any 'future state' (L10 attractor). This would falsify the L10/L15 'teleological' hypothesis in favor of pure randomness.

H3 (L15 vs L16): In a simulation (Paper 18), an L16 'I=Model(I)' loop will be shown to be *capable* of self-organizing and 'bootstrapping' its own L6/L7 'purpose' *without* being 'pulled' by an external L10/L15 'teleological attractor'. This would falsify the L15 'True Operator' as a *necessary* component.
Experimental_Protocols: Ref: Paper 17, Protocol 25.C (Ego-Death L7 Problem Solving)
Ref: Paper 17, Protocol 24.A (Pre-Stimulus L10 Retrocausality Test)
Simulation_Suite: Ref: Paper 18, Sim 12.1 (L15-L16 Teleological Operator Model)
